question: Which city was the capital of "Free France" between 1940 and 1943?
explanation: Brazzaville was the capital of "Free France" between 1940 and 1943 during the period of World War II when France was under the occupation of Germany, under Axis Powers. It was the decision of the Empire Defence Council to designate Brazzaville, the capital of French Equatorial Africa, as the administrative seat of Free France. It was ratified by the Barzaville Manifesto.
